philosophy: Generate an editable React MVP as a starting point, not a full production app. Something workable that users can iterate on.

questions.question: What kind of app do you want to build?

options.label: Small Business Landing Page
options.description: A single-page site for a local business or startup with hero, features, testimonials, and contact sections.

options.label: Knowledge Graphs / Knowledge Base / RAG
options.description: A knowledge management app with entity relationships, search, and retrieval-augmented generation.

options.label: SaaS (Software as a Service)
options.description: A subscription-based web application with user accounts, dashboards, and billing.

options.label: Game
options.description: A browser-based game with interactive mechanics, scoring, and visual feedback.

options.label: Dashboard / Admin Panel
options.description: A data-driven dashboard with charts, tables, filters, and real-time metrics.

options.label: E-commerce / Marketplace
options.description: A product listing and shopping app with cart, checkout, and product detail pages.

options.label: Social / Community App
options.description: A social platform with user profiles, feeds, posts, and interactions.

options.label: Portfolio / Personal Site
options.description: A personal portfolio showcasing projects, skills, and contact information.

questions.question: What's the primary purpose of your app in one sentence?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Help freelancers track their invoices and get paid faster

questions.question: Who is your target user?
questions.placeholder: e.g., developers, business owners, students, gamers

questions.question: What are the 3-5 core features you need in the MVP?
questions.placeholder: e.g., user login, task board with drag-and-drop, real-time notifications, export to PDF

questions.question: What data does your app need to display or manage?
questions.placeholder: e.g., user profiles, product listings, analytics metrics, blog posts

options.label: Yes
options.description: Include login/signup flow with mock auth in the MVP.

options.label: Later
options.description: Not for the MVP, but plan the structure for adding it later.

options.label: Minimal
options.description: Clean whitespace, simple typography, subtle borders.

options.label: Professional
options.description: Corporate feel, muted tones, structured layout.

options.label: Playful
options.description: Rounded corners, fun colors, casual tone.

options.label: Dark Mode
options.description: Dark backgrounds, high contrast, modern feel.

questions.question: Do you need any external integrations?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Stripe payments, Google Maps, REST API, Firebase, none

questions.question: What's the most important user action or flow in the app?
questions.placeholder: e.g., user signs up, creates a project, invites team members, and starts collaborating

questions.question: Any specific tech preferences or constraints?
questions.placeholder: e.g., must use TypeScript, needs to be mobile-first, keep it under 5 files, use dark theme
